intro: Draba apiculata, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments. The plant features basal rosettes of dark green, woolly leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is well adapted to cold, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. Draba apiculata plays an important role in alpine ecosystems, contributing to soil stabilization and providing nectar for pollinators.
